intro: Chrysocoma preacaa, commonly known as the African silverleaf tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elliptical, woody fruits containing seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine, and the plant has some ornamental value due to its distinctive appearance.
